The Praise of the Six-Armed Form of the Wish-Fulfilling Wheel Bodhisattva, which is suddenly realized upon hearing the true Dharma.
Holding a wish-fulfilling jewel in the hand, with a golden-colored body and six arms,
with a jeweled crown ornament, the sovereign king expounds the Dharma.
The first hand contemplates, out of compassion for sentient beings,
the second holds the wish-fulfilling jewel, able to fulfill all wishes,
the third holds a rosary, in order to liberate from the suffering of the animal realm.
The left hand rests on the luminous mountain, accomplishing unshakable stability,
the second holds a lotus hand, able to purify all that is improper,
the third hand holds a wheel, able to turn the unsurpassed Dharma.
The jewel is able to bestow according to one's wishes, the mountain represents immovability,
the lotus nature is unstained, the wheel crushes obstacles and afflictions.
The six arms are extensively adorned, able to roam through the six realms,
